item.title: OIC leaders back Bangladesh bid for UN General Assembly presidency
item.description: Senior figures from across the Muslim world have expressed support for Bangladesh’s candidature to preside over the 81st session of the UN General Assembly, as Dhaka’s new government seeks to reposition itself diplomatically following a landslide election victory. During bilateral meet

item.title: Algerian president congratulates Bangladesh’s PM
item.description: President of Algeria Abdelmadjid Tebboune has congratulated Bangladesh’s newly elected Prime Minister Tarique Rahman. In a goodwill message, President Tebboune warmly commended Prime Minister Rahman on his election win. He expressed admiration for the Prime Minister's leadership and vision

item.title: Americans doubt Trump’s booming economy claim, Reuters/Ipsos poll finds
item.description: President Donald Trump says the US economy is booming and that he has fixed inflation. But most Americans, including many in his Republican Party, do not see things that way, according to a Reuters/Ipsos poll. "This is the golden age of America," Trump said in his State of the Union address on Tue

item.title: Ex-SAD leader lands in jail over ‘attempted murder’
item.description: Abdur Razzak Bin Sulaiman Riyad, a former Students Against Discrimination leader previously accused of extortion, has been sent to jail in a new attempted murder case. Three other students from Presidency University, Riadul Hawlader, Alif Ahmed Ashik, and Sayem Shikdaer, were also sent to prison a

item.title: Pakistan says its air strikes hit 22 Afghan military targets, killing 274
item.description: Pakistani air strikes hit 22 Afghan military targets, Pakistan's military spokesperson said on Friday, after heavy fighting between the South Asian neighbours that began overnight. At least 12 Pakistani soldiers were killed and 274 Taliban officials and militants were killed since Thursday night,

item.title: Investment drive key to economic uplift: Khosru
item.description: Finance and Planning Minister Amir Khosru Mahmud Chowdhury has stressed the importance of domestic and foreign investment for Bangladesh’s economic recovery. Speaking on Friday during a visit to a proposed hospital site at Patenga Marine Drive in Chattogram, he said boosting investment is &l

item.title: Iran stored highly enriched uranium at underground site, IAEA report says
item.description: Some of Iran's most highly enriched uranium, close to weapons grade, was stored in an underground area of its nuclear site in Isfahan, the UN nuclear watchdog said in a confidential report sent to member states on Friday and seen by Reuters. It is the first time the International Atomic Energy Age

item.title: Passengers detained at Dhaka airport with foreign currencies worth over Tk 38 million
item.description: Two passengers have been detained at Shahjalal International Airport with foreign currencies worth over Tk 38 million, according to the Customs Intelligence and Investigation Directorate. On Friday, the agency said in a media statement that the seized currencies from the detainees include Saudi ri

item.title: Children enchanted by puppet show at Ekushey Book Fair
item.description: Children watched the puppet show with wide-eyed fascination as the second day of the Amar Ekushey Book Fair began in a lively atmosphere amid their cheerful presence. The fairgrounds gained a different level of vibrancy from the morning, with a strong presence of young visitors on the weekly holid

item.title: PM exchanges warm greetings with children after Jumu'ah prayers
item.description: Prime Minister Tarique Rahman exchanged warm greetings with children after offering the Jumu'ah prayers at a mosque in the city on Friday. "Prime Minister Tarique Rahman offered Jumu'ah prayers at the Naval Headquarters mosque here. After the prayers, he met children gathered outside the mosque an

item.title: BRAC Bank hosts ‘TARA Uddokta Mela 2026’ to showcase all-women entrepreneur products
item.description: BRAC Bank has hosted ‘TARA Uddokta Mela 2026’, a three-day fair to promote locally made products by women entrepreneurs and create a market for them, according to a press release. Inaugurated 27 February 2026, the fair will remain open to the public until March 1, 2026, every day from

item.title: Afghan Taliban open to talks after Pakistan bombs Kabul, Kandahar
item.description: Afghanistan's Taliban rulers said on Friday they were willing to negotiate after Pakistan bombed its forces in major cities and dozens of troops were killed in the most serious clashes between the allies-turned-foes.
